title: Add Hotels/Airbnb and Local Transport sections to Destination Detail pages

requirements.text: Update the Destination Detail page UI to include a dedicated lodging section that explicitly covers “Hotels” and “Airbnb” options (in addition to any existing homestay/guesthouse content), with clear headings and concise guidance in English.

quotes: ADD Hotel or AIRBNB section , Local transport section like rent a bike , Cab

acceptanceCriteria: On the destination detail route (/destinations/$slug), the content includes clearly labeled lodging subsections that explicitly mention “Hotels” and “Airbnb”.
All user-facing text added for these sections is in English.
The new lodging content matches the existing visual system (Card/card-glow, typography scale, spacing) used elsewhere on the page.

requirements.text: Add a new “Local Transport” section to the Destination Detail page that covers common options such as renting a bike and hiring a cab/taxi, using the existing component patterns (Cards, icons, and AffiliateCtaPlaceholder-style CTA placeholders where appropriate).

quotes: Local transport section like rent a bike , Cab

acceptanceCriteria: A new section titled “Local Transport” appears on the destination detail page as part of the main content flow.
The section includes at minimum: (1) Rent a Bike and (2) Cab/Taxi options, each described with short, scannable text.
Any CTAs in this section are placeholders (non-navigating), consistent with the existing AffiliateCtaPlaceholder behavior.
The section is visually consistent with existing sections and uses the existing motion/reveal pattern (MotionReveal) like other sections on the page.

constraints: Do not introduce any email capture, email submission prompts, or newsletter/lead-magnet UI while adding these sections.
Do not add real third-party booking integrations or outbound tracking; keep CTAs as placeholders consistent with current app behavior.
Do not modify files under frontend/src/components/ui (read-only components must be composed, not edited).
nonGoals: Building a full hotel/Airbnb inventory system or storing lodging/transport listings in the backend.
Implementing real affiliate deep links, payments, or checkout flows.
Adding real-time features (chat/support) for bookings or transport coordination.
